transcript: [What is the one recent trend you can’t stand and why?] One trend that I find very annoying is how much people rely on their cellphones, to do everything in the world for them. For example, I have friends who will not answer their cell phone, who will only text. Sometimes it's difficult to have a conversation about a delicate subject when you have to sit there, and type on a little tiny keyboard what you want to say because my phone's voice recognition does not always pick up my voice. Hopefully, this study will help that. But anyway, (I) I think that people are becoming less and less personal and this really annoys me. Pretty soon we are not gonna be able to even see each other, we're just gonna talk on the internet and type on our phones. Enough.

I find her very intriguing and interesting and I would like to know if she's as beautiful in real life as she is in the movies. For example, Elizabeth Taylor was Cleopatra. (you can) If you can buy it in those little plastic containers, that's the best way. If you have to shell it yourself, it's not as good. (I) I never did learn how to do crab very well. There's also a wonderful restaurant in Tucson Arizona that has the best macaroni and cheese I've ever tasted, but I can't get the recipe. I think it has gouda in it, but (it) it has some special kind of pasta that I don't remember the name of. And then there's carrot cake. Carrot cake is what I get every year for my birthday. It's rich and moist and has the best icing, cream cheese icing. And I think that's why I love it so much, because the icing is very sweet, but the cake is not very sweet which compliments each other. So those are my three favorite foods, bye.

I believe the steps would be to first call for roadside assistance and then start finding the spare and undoing the nuts that hold the spare in the trunk. So once you undo the nuts, you can pull the tire out. Then I would look for the car jack, and assemble it and jack up the side of the car that needed repair. Then you would have to find the tool that undoes the lug nuts on the damaged tire and take them off. Then I think you would put on the new tire and put on the nuts again to secure the tire. Then I think you can let down (the um) the thing that holds the car up and (uh) then you would put everything back away. And then you would drive very carefully and slowly for the first little bit to make sure nothing went wrong. I would recheck how tight the lug nuts were a couple miles down the road. That's my best guess at how to change a tire. I don't really know.

Because now that I'm not going to work every day, I don't have to get up at a specific time. So I want to make sure that I didn't miss a call or an appointment or something that I should've gotten up earlier for. But my routine is always to start with a cup of coffee. It's actually an espresso because I really enjoy espresso as a way of kicking off the day. And then I usually have another one. And then I look through to see what is planned for the day. transcript: [Describe your favorite TV show.] My favorite TV show is probably "The Good Doctor" because as someone with autism, (he) it was portrayed in a realistic way, and felt like I could connect with the character, and it didn't feel like the story was being made up without the input of the autistic community. I think that show really did embrace autism, and all of the challenges, and stresses that come with that. Especially, as in the show he was a surgeon, and that itself presents massive sensory and emotional-social challenges.
